subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Any eBay sellers willing to do this?
author: Marlboro63@aol.com
full_text:
-------------------------------1207607859
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Hi Margaret,
 
I am like Bruce in the fact that I have given away radios too.  I am  not 
rich but I gave (4) radios to deserving individuals to help further their  
knowledge and research.  Even if I lost a couple of bucks on the venture I  still 
think it would be worth it for people to know that we are out there and  they 
are not alone when they want to try and get into this research field.   Its 
always nice to know that we are all just an email away.  And I think it  would 
send a message to this guy in New York that there are people out here that  take 
this very seriously and are not in it for the monetary gain but for the  
educational and research end of it.  
 
Jeff
 
 
In a message dated 4/7/2008 5:30:32 P.M. Central Daylight Time,  
ITCdeadpeople@... writes:

 
 
 
Hi Jeff. Sorry for my blasting you. I still feel that taking a loss on a  
product is not sending 
any meaningful message to the guy, and would only  possibly prevent one sale, 
for every 
unit sold at a loss ... but providing  a listing at a minimal fee (with no 
hassles of money up 
front, going to  the post office, etc.) would work great. 

Again, sorry for being  Devil's Advocate. :-( As I posted to Bruce and 
Jeremy... essentially, 
I am  on the same moral page with the rest of you! 

Margaret

--- In _EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com) ,  
Marlboro63@.,  Mar
>
> Hi Kay,
> 
> That was  what I posted on my original idea over a week ago and I was 
blasted 
>  about it especially that I would look like a fool that I was willing to 
take  
> a loss of a few bucks. But atleast the hacking information and links  would 
> have been posted on ebay for all to see.
> 
>  Jeff
> 
> 
> In a message dated 4/7/2008 4:58:03 P.M.  Central Daylight Time, 
> psfponies@.. psfponie
> 
>  
> 
> 
> I checked to see what it would cost to sell one of  ebay. To list it 
> it is $1.00 for $25.00-449.00 plus 8.75% of the  initial $25.00 
> ($2.19), plus 3.50% of the remaining closing value  balance ($25.01 
> to $1,000.00)
> 
> 
> I would be  willing to list the one I have plus give the information 
> on the free  hacking and that fact that you can get one at Radio 
> Shack for $24.99  just to shut this guy down. At the most I would be 
> out $1.00 to not  sell it!!!! Well worth it I'd say.
> 
> Can someone send me the  written instructions on how to hack the 12-
> 249.
> 
>  Kay
> 
> --- In _EVP-ITC@yahoogroup --- In _EVP-IT_EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ 
(mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com) ) ,  "LC 
> Duplatt" <lcdupla@> wrote:
> >
> > Either  that, or anyone willing to make them for $25 + shipping 
> with 
>  > no profit? You could then list them just like the ones that are 
>  > selling...so they pull up identical to the listings that are up 
>  > there. :)
> > 
> > LC
> > 
> > --- In  _EVP-ITC@yahoogroup --- In  _EV_EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ 
(mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com) ) ,  
> "itcdeadpeople" <ITCdeadpeople@> 
> >  wrote:
> > >
> > > I was thinking if someone would  list a FREE DOWNLOAD of 
> > instructions for the various hacks  
> > > on the Radio Shack units, it could put an end to the  business 
> for 
> > sellers that are taking 
> > >  advantage of people who are unaware that they could probably 
> hack  
> > the units for 
> > > themselves. 
> > >  
> > > I have seen "downloads" of various things listed before.  Why 
> not 
> > this?
> > > 
> > >  Margaret
> > >
> >
> 
> 
>
